AccountAccessType.description: These enums represent valid account access types. Specifically these enums determine whether the workspace can access AWS resources in the AWS account only, or whether it can also access resources in other accounts in the same organization. If the value CURRENT_ACCOUNT is used, a workspace role ARN must be provided. If the value is ORGANIZATION, a list of organizational units must be provided.

AssertionAttributes.description: Maps Grafana friendly names to the IdPs SAML attributes.

properties.name: Email
properties.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users email in Grafana.

type.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users email in Grafana.

properties.name: Groups
properties.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users groups in Grafana.

type.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users groups in Grafana.

properties.name: Login
properties.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users login handle in Grafana.

type.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users login handle in Grafana.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users name in Grafana.

type.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users name in Grafana.

properties.name: Org
properties.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users organizations in Grafana.

type.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users organizations in Grafana.

properties.name: Role
properties.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users roles in Grafana.

type.description: Name of the attribute within the SAML assert to use as the users roles in Grafana.

DataSourceType.description: These enums represent valid AWS data sources that can be queried via the Grafana workspace. These data sources are primarily used to help customers visualize which data sources have been added to a service managed workspace IAM role.

IdpMetadata.description: IdP Metadata used to configure SAML authentication in Grafana.

properties.name: Url
properties.description: URL that vends the IdPs metadata.

type.description: URL that vends the IdPs metadata.

properties.name: Xml
properties.description: XML blob of the IdPs metadata.

type.description: XML blob of the IdPs metadata.

NetworkAccessControl.description: The configuration settings for Network Access Control.

properties.name: PrefixListIds
properties.description: The list of prefix list IDs. A prefix list is a list of CIDR ranges of IP addresses. The IP addresses specified are allowed to access your workspace. If the list is not included in the configuration then no IP addresses will be allowed to access the workspace.

type.description: The list of prefix list IDs. A prefix list is a list of CIDR ranges of IP addresses. The IP addresses specified are allowed to access your workspace. If the list is not included in the configuration then no IP addresses will be allowed to access the workspace.

properties.name: VpceIds
properties.description: The list of Amazon VPC endpoint IDs for the workspace. If a NetworkAccessConfiguration is specified then only VPC endpoints specified here will be allowed to access the workspace.

type.description: The list of Amazon VPC endpoint IDs for the workspace. If a NetworkAccessConfiguration is specified then only VPC endpoints specified here will be allowed to access the workspace.

NotificationDestinationType.description: These enums represent valid AWS notification destinations that the Grafana workspace has permission to use. These notification destinations are primarily used to help customers visualize which destinations have been added to a service managed IAM role.

PermissionType.description: These enums represent valid permission types to use when creating or configuring a Grafana workspace. The SERVICE_MANAGED permission type means the Managed Grafana service will create a workspace IAM role on your behalf. The CUSTOMER_MANAGED permission type means that the customer is expected to provide an IAM role that the Grafana workspace can use to query data sources.

RoleValues.description: Maps SAML roles to the Grafana Editor and Admin roles.

properties.name: Admin
properties.description: List of SAML roles which will be mapped into the Grafana Admin role.

type.description: List of SAML roles which will be mapped into the Grafana Admin role.

properties.name: Editor
properties.description: List of SAML roles which will be mapped into the Grafana Editor role.

type.description: List of SAML roles which will be mapped into the Grafana Editor role.

SamlConfiguration.description: SAML configuration data associated with an AMG workspace.

properties.name: AllowedOrganizations
properties.description: List of SAML organizations allowed to access Grafana.

type.description: List of SAML organizations allowed to access Grafana.

properties.name: LoginValidityDuration
properties.description: The maximum lifetime an authenticated user can be logged in (in minutes) before being required to re-authenticate.

type.description: The maximum lifetime an authenticated user can be logged in (in minutes) before being required to re-authenticate.

VpcConfiguration.description: The configuration settings for an Amazon VPC that contains data sources for your Grafana workspace to connect to.

properties.name: SecurityGroupIds
properties.description: The list of Amazon EC2 security group IDs attached to the Amazon VPC for your Grafana workspace to connect.

type.description: The list of Amazon EC2 security group IDs attached to the Amazon VPC for your Grafana workspace to connect.

properties.name: SubnetIds
properties.description: The list of Amazon EC2 subnet IDs created in the Amazon VPC for your Grafana workspace to connect.

type.description: The list of Amazon EC2 subnet IDs created in the Amazon VPC for your Grafana workspace to connect.

WorkspaceStatus.description: These enums represent the status of a workspace.

properties.name: AuthenticationProviders
properties.description: List of authentication providers to enable.

type.description: List of authentication providers to enable.

properties.name: ClientToken
properties.description: A unique, case-sensitive, user-provided identifier to ensure the idempotency of the request.

type.description: A unique, case-sensitive, user-provided identifier to ensure the idempotency of the request.

properties.name: DataSources
properties.description: List of data sources on the service managed IAM role.

type.description: List of data sources on the service managed IAM role.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Description of a workspace.

type.description: Description of a workspace.

properties.name: GrafanaVersion
properties.description: The version of Grafana to support in your workspace.

type.description: The version of Grafana to support in your workspace.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The user friendly name of a workspace.

type.description: The user friendly name of a workspace.

properties.name: NotificationDestinations
properties.description: List of notification destinations on the customers service managed IAM role that the Grafana workspace can query.

type.description: List of notification destinations on the customers service managed IAM role that the Grafana workspace can query.

properties.name: OrganizationRoleName
properties.description: The name of an IAM role that already exists to use with AWS Organizations to access AWS data sources and notification channels in other accounts in an organization.

type.description: The name of an IAM role that already exists to use with AWS Organizations to access AWS data sources and notification channels in other accounts in an organization.

properties.name: OrganizationalUnits
properties.description: List of Organizational Units containing AWS accounts the Grafana workspace can pull data from.

type.description: List of Organizational Units containing AWS accounts the Grafana workspace can pull data from.

properties.name: PluginAdminEnabled
properties.description: Allow workspace admins to install plugins

type.description: Allow workspace admins to install plugins

properties.name: RoleArn
properties.description: IAM Role that will be used to grant the Grafana workspace access to a customers AWS resources.

type.description: IAM Role that will be used to grant the Grafana workspace access to a customers AWS resources.

properties.name: StackSetName
properties.description: The name of the AWS CloudFormation stack set to use to generate IAM roles to be used for this workspace.

type.description: The name of the AWS CloudFormation stack set to use to generate IAM roles to be used for this workspace.

properties.name: CreationTimestamp
properties.description: Timestamp when the workspace was created.

type.description: Timestamp when the workspace was created.

properties.name: Endpoint
properties.description: Endpoint for the Grafana workspace.

type.description: Endpoint for the Grafana workspace.

properties.name: Id
properties.description: The id that uniquely identifies a Grafana workspace.

type.description: The id that uniquely identifies a Grafana workspace.

properties.name: ModificationTimestamp
properties.description: Timestamp when the workspace was last modified

type.description: Timestamp when the workspace was last modified

properties.name: SsoClientId
properties.description: The client ID of the AWS SSO Managed Application.

type.description: The client ID of the AWS SSO Managed Application.
